title: CA Divorce: Timeframe of debts on form FL-160.
question: Hi,
answers: Credit card debt should as of the date of separation. If you paid some of it, you may be entitled to a reimbursement. As to lease, it is a debt to be paid.

List the Credit card debt as of both dates. Yes you should list the leased cars since they will have
to be divided.

I agree with Mr. Litz. You should state the balances as of the date of separation AND the most current balances. You may also want to include an attachment listing the post-separation payments you have made. If you feel restricted by the form, don't be afraid to include your own attachment which provides further information.
The more disclosure you provide, the better.
